caption_original: Canada is truly a maritime nation with a rich marine heritage. caption_original:
This V-E Day, we‚Äôre remembering the #HomeportHeroes who served in Canada‚Äôs Merchant Navy and aided Allied victory in the Second World War. 

From December 1941 until the end of the war in 1945, Canadian shipyards on both coasts, and along the St. Lawrence River, undertook a massive emergency shipbuilding campaign to deliver hundreds of desperately-needed vessels to support the Allied war effort. Naval ships like destroyer HMCS Haida National Historic Site escorted merchant convoys to protect against submarine and air attacks. #LestWeForget http://ow.ly/79eS30brkUz

caption_original: There‚Äôs just so many things we want to celebrate today: the International day of Museums, the 100th anniversary of National Historic Sites, and of course, #Canada150! Tell us in the comments which national historic sites you plan to visit this year!!

caption_original:
Not long after gold was discovered in large quantities in the Klondike, dredges were brought into the Yukon. One of the two dozen dredges that worked this area, Dredge No. 4 is 2/3 the size of a football field and more than seven stories high! It could dig in an hour what took three men all day. Find out more about the Klondike National Historic Sites: http://ow.ly/QQab30b3p3K Parks Canada Yukon Travel Yukon 

To celebrate #Canada150, we're featuring ALL of our 200+ places across our social media accounts. Did you know 2017 also marks the centennial of national historic sites? Stay tuned!

caption_original:
First built during the War of 1812 to defend the St. Lawrence River shipping route from attack by the United States, Fort Wellington National Historic Site helped thwart another American invasion during the 1837-38 Upper and Lower Canada rebellions. Take part in military drill, witness a cannon firing, savour period treats cooked over an open fire, or play games from long ago: the possibilities are endless! http://ow.ly/UNP130bkHgQ #NHS100 Ontario Travel

To celebrate #Canada150, we're featuring ALL of our 200+ places across our social media accounts. Did you know 2017 also marks the centennial of national historic sites? Stay tuned!

caption_original:
Get your hands on history this summer at Fort George National Historic Site with a full summer of activities!  Step straight from the genteel Victorian town of Niagara-on-the-Lake into the War of 1812 at Fort George, a military post that defended Upper Canada against American attacks. Experience that era by tasting food cooked 19th century-style over an open flame, then: musket firing anyone? http://ow.ly/JAX930bkzge Ontario Travel

To celebrate #Canada150, we're featuring ALL of our 200+ places across our social media accounts. Did you know 2017 also marks the centennial of national historic sites? Stay tuned!

Looking to dust off your green thumb? This summer, come and visit #LowerFortGarry and put your gardening skills to the test!  You and your kids are invited to prepare the soil, do some planting, watering and maintenance of the gardens, and even participate in the harvest with the help of our historical interpreters!

Looking for a family gardening experience you can do at home? This #ClubParka activity helps you create a vegetable garden just right for your space and climate!

http://www.pc.gc.ca/en/serapprocher-connect/parka/clubparka/activ-09
